titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Charles Maynard Cooke papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Harold P. Anderson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-21T08:37-0700

change.item: Revised to add links to digital collections site by Sarah Patton.

Declassified records series added by Lisa Miller. March 23, 2004: PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Charles M. Cooke Papers)//EN" "cookecm.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

did.abstract: Correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, dispatches, memoranda, and photographs relating to American naval operations in World War II, inter-Allied diplomacy in World War II, the defenses of Taiwan, and American domestic and foreign policy. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 36 closed. Eligible to be opened in 2025. Remainder of collection is open for research. Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items, computer media, and digital files. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Charles Maynard Cooke papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1968.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternate Forms Available
altformavail.p: Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

chronitem.event: Born, Fort Smith, Arkansas
B.S., University of Arkansas
Midshipman, U.S. Naval Academy
Commissioned, Ensign
Submarine duty
Promoted to the rank of Lieutenant (junior grade)
Assistant Inspector of Machinery, Fore River Shipbuilding Corporation
Naval member, First Naval District Section of Joint Army and Navy Survey of Merchant Vessels
Promoted to the rank of Lieutenant
Promoted to the rank of Lieutenant Commander
Superintendant and Engineer Officer, Naval Station, Cavite, Philippine Islands
Promoted to the rank of Commander
Promoted to the rank of Captain
Commander, Submarine Division Eleven, Pearl Harbor, Hawaii
Commandant, Naval Station, Guantanamo Bay, Cuba
Fleet War Plans and Logistics Officer, U.S. Fleet
Staff, War Plans Division, Office of the Chief of Naval Operations
Commanding officer, U.S.S. Pennsylvania
Promoted to the rank of Rear Admiral
Deputy Chief of Staff, U.S. Fleet
Promoted to the rank of Vice Admiral
Chief of Staff to the Commander-in-Chief, U.S. Fleet (Deputy Chief of Naval Operations)
Distinguished Service Medal
Promoted to the rank of Admiral
Commander, Seventh Fleet, Western Pacific (U.S. Naval Force, Western Pacific)
Transfered to the Retired List of the Navy
Coordinator, Commerce International China, Special Technician Program (STP) to the Republic of China (Taiwan); unofficial advisor to the government of Chiang Kai-shek
Director, Ingalls Taiwan Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company
Died

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, speeches and writings, reports, dispatches, memoranda, and photographs relating to American naval operations in World War II, inter-Allied diplomacy in World War II, the defenses of Taiwan, and American domestic and foreign policy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Log entries of air flights made by Cooke, 1931-1948; typewritten diary, 1946; and holograph appointment and address notations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holograph, typescript, carbon, mimeograph, and printed copies of speeches, radio broadcasts, articles, essays, reviews, public statements, congressional testimony, reports, and interviews, and accompanying correspondence, notes, and news clippings, arranged alphabetically by title, or form in cases where no title is available, with page length of the most complete draft or copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Official correspondence, reports, memoranda, orders, vouchers, messages, notes, rosters, lists, conference papers, minutes, charts, maps, and diagrams accumulated by Cooke during his naval career. The organization of material, patterned as closely as possible after Cooke's own organization, begins with a chronological arrangement of the Navy Department orders affecting Cooke's duty assignments, continues with a chronological arrangement (by year, month, and day) of material dealing with general naval affairs, and concludes with an alphabetical arrangement of material related to major projects and assignments in which Cooke was involved. Citations to selected memoranda and reports have been added under many subseries in order to indicate the variety and significance of the material authored and collected by Cooke during his career.

did.unittitle: Navy Department orders (change of duty), endorsements, and vouchers,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Midshipman Age Limits for Entrance in the U.S. Naval Academy," 1930 April 5.

scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Selection for Promotion of Commissioned Officers in the United States Navy," 1931 May 12.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Submarine Organization with the U.S. Fleet and the Assignment of Commanders," 1936 July 2, and "Battleship Design," 1936 December.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Naval Aviation Policies," 1937 October 1.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Fleet Organization," 1938 April 28, "Fleet War Plans," 1938 June 5, "Some Principles Affecting Zigzagging," 1938 June 5, and "Atlantic War Plans," 1938 October 7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Crenshaw, R. S. "Steps to be Taken in the Event that England and France Enter the War Against Germany," 1939 September 1; and Cooke, C. M. "Organization and Command of Major Forces of the U.S. Fleet," 1939 November 16.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Characteristics of Heavy Cruisers," 1940 March 23.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Office of Naval Intelligence. "Combatant Vessels of the Seven Principle Naval Powers," and "Number of Vessels Lost Incident to the Present War," 1945 January 1 and September 1; Strausz-HupÃ©, Robert. Outline of proposal to establish a research unit concerned with the study of seapower within the framework of national policy (letter from M. B. Gardner to Admiral Cooke attached), 1945 April 10; "Analysis of the Venezuelan Revolution of October 19, 1945," 1945 October 24; and "The Joint Chiefs of Staff Organization, World War II," 1945.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes "Naval Effort in China," 1947 February.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

M. Cooke, U.S. Navy, to Admiral O. C. Badger, U.S. Navy," 1948 February; and "Narrative History of Seventh Fleet and Naval Forces Western Pacific, 8 January 1946 - 24 February 1948," 1948 February.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes lists of important personalities in Chinese cities.

"Moroccan Conference Trip, January 1943," 1943 January 31, and "A Pattern for the War in the Pacific," 1943 March 6.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Miles, M. E. "SACO," 1943 April 1; and Headquarters, U.S. Forces, China Theater. (A. Wedemeyer-?). "Far East Strategy - 1945" (see also: Pacific Theater, Volume III, "Far East Strategy"), 1945 February.

scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Application of Production to Strategical Requirements," speech before members of the War Production Board Council, 1942 October 20, and "Allocation of United States Built Landing Craft," 1942 October 29.

did.unittitle: Strategic policy for the conduct of the war,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Cooke, C. M. "Functions of the Offices of Strategic Services," 1942 November 26; "Strategic Policy of the United States for the Conduct of the War," 1942 November 27; Cooke, C. M. "Basic Strategic Concept for 1943," 1942 December 28; Joint Planners. "Global Estimate of the Situation," 1943 April 28; Cooke, C. M. "Conduct of the War in 1943-1944," comments to Admiral King attached, 1943 May 5; and "U.S. - British Strategy," circa 1943.

COMMERCE INTERNATIONAL CHINA, SPECIAL TECHNICIAN PROGRAM (STP) TO THE REPUBLIC OF CHINA PROJECT FILE,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, lists, diagrams, contracts, agreements, financial records, plans, maps, and charts related to a project, coordinated by Cooke, to assist the organization, training, and equipment maintenance programs of the military services of the Republic of China (Taiwan). Arranged alphabetically by subseries.

Technical memoranda, inspection reports, and correspondence related to the organization, training, and equipment maintenance programs of the Republic of China,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, financial statements, publicity releases, organizational charts, and diagrams related to a project, in which Cooke participated, to increase the productive capacity of shipyard facilities in Taiwan. Arranged alphabetically by subseries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Autobiographical and biographical material, including vitae, biographical sketches, and correspondence, concerning Cooke and the Cooke family history. Also includes awards, citations, and diplomas received by Cooke.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains 85 photos and 20 duplicate photos in 2 envelopes.

did.unittitle: 5 photos and 3 duplicates of Cooke with Chiang Kai-shek and/or Madame Chiang, circa 1950s; 1 photo of Cooke with Hansen Baldwin, Robert Patterson, and Lewis B. Hershey; 1 photo of Mrs. C. M. Cooke; 1 photo i.d. card of Cooke; 1 photo of Cooke with British naval officers, circa 1940s; 1 photo of unidentified U.S. naval officer; 7 photos of Ingalls Taiwan Shipbuilding project; 4 photo of Alfred and Ida Kohlberg at the National Defense Medical Center, Taiwan, 1953; 17 photos of Cooke alone and on various social occasions, undated

15 photos of Cooke with various Nationalist Chinese military personnel; 11 photos and 17 duplicates of nationalist Chinese military activities; 21 photos of various people, places and things, perhaps in China and Taiwan, circa 1946-1951

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes interfiled, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.
